title: im sick and tired or range champions getting to freely auto attack me while taking no minion agro
body: hundreds of games ive watch this happen.. i mostly play melee champions. and whenever im vs range they can just sit back and auto attack me 3/4 times in a  row and take what? one caster minion agro and thats it. but god forbid i auto attack them once all hell breaks lose. the enemy minions chase and attack me until i go under tower or to a damn bush. the melee to range matchups are so fucking one sided early game its ridiculous. make minions chase ranged champions too like they do melee. like come the fuck on. shits unfair as hell.

replies.body: It's actually kinda sad, whenever I'm against a ranged matchup as Kat (which, let's face it, is most of them in mid), when I go in for a Q-E-Auto trade, I take nearly as much damage back from creeps, but they can just walk up and auto attack me whenever, and all that happens is they pull the wave closer to their side of the map, and then the minions get bored and go back to what they were doing.

Well there _is_ supposed to be an inherent advantage in terms of early poke when vs ranged as a melee champion. That much makes sense. Why wouldn't someone with 550 range not sit there and auto-attack you? I'm going to assume that you're talking about Akali since it's in your name. She's had tools in her kit to make up for this. Doran's Shield really helps you stay healthy enough early while in lane and based on your match history, you rarely build it. Also, you can hard push the lane to force the enemy to focus on waveclearing instead of focusing on you. However, be wary when doing that because if your laner has a lot of waveclear early, they can freeze the wave under their turret.

Can this stop being posted please? I see this at least once a month. There is no correlation between attack range and provocation of minion aggro, that is a fact and no amount of arguing or replays will get around that.

Instead of dividing melee and ranged champions even more we should be uniting and discussing how minion aggro is extremely RNG in the first place regardless of range, you can attack someone once and multiple minions will literally chase you into your turret, or you can attack someone 5 times in a row and the minions will ignore you. It has nothing to do with range (stop saying it does) it is simply that the system as a whole is completely random and needs an overhaul.

Actually, there is. Depending on the champion and their AA range, they can abuse League's minion AI and not actually be attacked by them. If you AA and walk backwards as a ranged champion, by the time the closest minion  aggros onto you, you're already out of its aggro range and then it deprioritises you and attacks something else.

Actually, I don't know the specific rules on it, but there are very different outcomes for range vs. melee to my knowledge. Easiest example to give in my opinion is when an enemy is fleeing a tower because he knows he can't hold it. Once that enemy gets a certain distance outside his tower's sight, the tower doesn't see you anymore. You can deal damage to that champion from the base of an enemy tower and it won't aggro you if the enemy is outside the tower's sight range (which I believe to be just a hair outside the attacking range). You also don't draw aggro if the positions are switched and you're outside the enemy turret's sight range. That leaves a lot of room for abusing tower aggro when the odds are stacked against the turret's team.

Similarly, a ranged champion can do the exact same thing to melee champions with minions: attack out of minion aggro range (at least moreso than the melee champion could possibly do), and skate past minions mostly undisturbed to finish off that champion inside the enemy minion's aggro range, but while the melee champion is outside of it, and ultimately still not disturb the minions. This is very easy to do with a handful of champions like your Teemos and Lucians who can either deal heavy damage with intermittent hits, or who can combo quickly for damage while keeping distance, and follow up on a fleeing situation at the most opportune time.

Range is a very effective tool against tower aggro, and is similarly useful against minion aggro as well.

Except it’s not rng. It’s just that the call for help mechanisms from minions inherently favor champions that are further away because they don’t enter combat soon enough to reaggro. Sure, if a ranged champion stands at melee range it will behave exactly the same as melee, but otherwise there’s a solid few seconds before minions can reach a ranged champ, which makes them deaggro because they don’t have “calls for help.”

Only if they miss/waste their CC. If I go in on a lux and she binds me in the creep wave, I lose the trade hard and am forced to disengage having lost half-3/4 of my hp.

If I go in on a lux and she misses her binding, there is no longer a lux in the lane.
